DOC.brief_summary: Background : Early diagnosis respiratory impairment Post-Polio ( PPS ) patient may delay respiratory decline future need invasive respiratory aid . Objectives : To compare pulmonary function measure , maximal respiratory pressure activity level fatigue respiratory muscle patient PPS healthy control . Design : Cross-sectional study . Setting : Hadassah physical medicine rehabilitation department , Jerusalem . Patients : Patients PPS ( N=12 ; 6 male ; age 62.1±11.6 year ) able walk 6 minute without human assistance ; age-matched healthy subject ( N=12 ; 4 male ; age 62.2±6.5 year ) . Intervention : None . Measurements : A body plethysmograph use quantify forced expiratory volume first second force expiratory maneuver , vital capacity , slow vital capacity , Residual Volume ( RV ) , Total Lung Capacity ( TLC ) , Thoracic Gas Volume ( TGV ) . Also , RV TLC ratio calculate . A manometer use measure Maximal Inspiratory Pressure ( MIP ) Maximal Expiratory Pressure ( MEP ) . A spirometer use measure Maximal Voluntary Ventilation ( MVV ) . Surface electromyography ( sEMG ) record diaphragmatic muscle activity rest perform MVV .
DOC.brief_title: Activity Fatigue Respiratory Muscles Pulmonary Characteristics Post-Polio Patients
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed postpolio syndrome Able walk 6 minute , without walk aid orthotics without human assistance Any neurological orthopedic condition , unrelated postpolio syndrome
